subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... This is certainly an improvement over the current JUnit behavior, but I still find that: 101 TESTS, 1 FAILURE, 100 SKIPPED is much clearer... -- Cédric
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Robert Watkins

> 101 TESTS, 101 RAN, 1 FAILURE, 100 ERRORS
>
> Of course, to get this you need:
> 1) A test runner that will report in this format. :) Most
> don't, but they will give equivalent information.
> 2) Test structures setup accordingly - you need to have that
> test outside of the first test case that will fail rather than error.

This is certainly an improvement over the current JUnit behavior, but I
still find that:

101 TESTS, 1 FAILURE, 100 SKIPPED

is much clearer...

--
Cédric
http://beust.com/weblog
